metadata.metaValue:
Before using OpenCL nodes, verify a device is active by viewing the `device_info` object with the data browser.

---

the '`devices`' property lists the system's OpenCL ready devices. 

- Nvidia GPUs:
> OpenCL runtime is included with the driver, no additional setup required.

- For the CPU:
> OpenCL runtime must be installed. this can be downloaded from [Intel's website](https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/developer/tools/opencl-cpu-runtime/overview.html). (This will work for AMD CPUs as well)

---

Currently only one device can be utilized at a time, device **0** by default. To specify a different device, set the device id evironment variable, e.g.:

```
HYUU_OPENCL_DEVICE_ID = 1
```
Copy the cotents of `source` to a text editor for easier viewing

float, long, uint, bool, string, Math::float2, Math::float3, Math::float4, Math::float3x3, Math::float4x4, array<float>, array<long>, array<uint>, array<bool>, array<string>, array<Math::float2>, array<Math::float3>, array<Math::float4>, array<Math::float3x3>, array<Math::float4x4>
Allocate empty buffer to fill with output data
Allocate indices buffer and buffer with one element, this will hold `true Count`
Slice to read data only for cells in set
Skip if no points in set

###### **IMPORTANT 1/2**
For OpenCL float3 and float4 both occupy 16 bytes. To pass Math::float3 to OpenCL **it must be promoted to Math::float4 first!**

This also applies to int3/4, uint3/4, etc.

nodes like  `allocate_buffer_of_type` and `write_buffer`  will do this automatically for the most part

###### **IMPORTANT 2/2**
For reading buffers, you will notice there is no float3 type option. Instead read the buffer as float4, and demote to float3 if necessary.

This also applies to int3/4, uint3/4, etc.

Depending on your hardware this could
be faster on the cpu. The position calculation is simple, so overhead from buffer reading may out weigh the gpu's compute advantage.

float, long, uint, bool, string, Math::float2, Math::float3, Math::float4, Math::float3x3, Math::float4x4, array<float>, array<long>, array<uint>, array<bool>, array<string>, array<Math::float2>, array<Math::float3>, array<Math::float4>, array<Math::float3x3>, array<Math::float4x4>
